data.sentence: The word عَنْهُمُ comes from the root ع ن and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.
data.sentence: The word الْعَذَابَ comes from the root ع ذ ب and is associated with the meanings: chastisement, castigate, punishment, torture, torment, retribution, abstain/desist, relinquish, quit.adhb - sweet (usually water), e.g. 25:53, 35:12.

data.meanings: To pull away, remove, take off, open up, lay open lay base, uncover.
data.sentence: The word كَشَفْنَا comes from the root ك ش ف and is associated with the meanings: To pull away, remove, take off, open up, lay open lay base, uncover.

data.meanings: to break (promise), violate (treaty), untwist (cord), unravel, break into thread.
data.sentence: The word يَنْكُثُونَ comes from the root ن ك ث and is associated with the meanings: to break (promise), violate (treaty), untwist (cord), unravel, break into thread.
